refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Regions are a simple graphical data type representing an area of integer-aligned rectangles. They are often used on raster surfaces to track areas of interest, such as change or clip areas.

refsect2.title: cairo_region_create ()
refsect2.para: Allocates a new empty region object.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A newly allocated cairo_region_t. Free with cairo_region_destroy(). This function always returns a valid pointer; if memory cannot be allocated, then a special error object is returned where all operations on the object do nothing. You can check for this with cairo_region_status().

refsect2.title: cairo_region_create_rectangle ()
refsect2.para: Allocates a new region object containing rectangle .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A newly allocated cairo_region_t. Free with cairo_region_destroy(). This function always returns a valid pointer; if memory cannot be allocated, then a special error object is returned where all operations on the object do nothing. You can check for this with cairo_region_status().

refsect2.title: cairo_region_create_rectangles ()
refsect2.para: Allocates a new region object containing the union of all given rects .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A newly allocated cairo_region_t. Free with cairo_region_destroy(). This function always returns a valid pointer; if memory cannot be allocated, then a special error object is returned where all operations on the object do nothing. You can check for this with cairo_region_status().

refsect2.title: cairo_region_copy ()
refsect2.para: Allocates a new region object copying the area from original .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A newly allocated cairo_region_t. Free with cairo_region_destroy(). This function always returns a valid pointer; if memory cannot be allocated, then a special error object is returned where all operations on the object do nothing. You can check for this with cairo_region_status().

refsect2.title: cairo_region_reference ()
refsect2.para: Increases the reference count on region by one. This prevents region from being destroyed until a matching call to cairo_region_destroy() is made.

refsect2.title: cairo_region_destroy ()
refsect2.para: Destroys a cairo_region_t object created with cairo_region_create(), cairo_region_copy(), or or cairo_region_create_rectangle().

refsect2.title: cairo_region_status ()
refsect2.para: Checks whether an error has previous occurred for this region object.

refsect2.title: cairo_region_get_extents ()
refsect2.para: Gets the bounding rectangle of region as a cairo_rectangle_int_t

entry.para: rectangle into which to store the extents

refsect2.title: cairo_region_num_rectangles ()
refsect2.para: Returns the number of rectangles contained in region .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The number of rectangles contained in region .

refsect2.title: cairo_region_get_rectangle ()
refsect2.programlisting: void cairo_region_get_rectangle (const cairo_region_t *region, int nth, cairo_rectangle_int_t *rectangle);
refsect2.para: Stores the nth rectangle from the region in rectangle .

entry.para: a number indicating which rectangle should be returned

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if region is empty, FALSE if it isn't.

refsect2.title: cairo_region_contains_point ()
refsect2.programlisting: cairo_bool_t cairo_region_contains_point (const cairo_region_t *region, int x, int y);
refsect2.para: Checks whether (x , y ) is contained in region .

entry.para: the x coordinate of a point
the y coordinate of a point

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if (x , y ) is contained in region , FALSE if it is not.

refsect2.title: cairo_region_contains_rectangle ()
refsect2.para: Checks whether rectangle is inside, outside or partially contained in region

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: CAIRO_REGION_OVERLAP_IN if rectangle is entirely inside region , CAIRO_REGION_OVERLAP_OUT if rectangle is entirely outside region , or CAIRO_REGION_OVERLAP_PART if rectangle is partially inside and partially outside region .

refsect2.title: cairo_region_equal ()
refsect2.para: Compares whether region_a is equivalent to region_b. NULL as an argument is equal to itself, but not to any non-NULL region.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if both regions contained the same coverage, FALSE if it is not or any region is in an error status.

refsect2.title: cairo_region_translate ()
refsect2.programlisting: void cairo_region_translate (cairo_region_t *region, int dx, int dy);

entry.para: Amount to translate in the x direction
Amount to translate in the y direction

refsect2.title: cairo_region_intersect ()
refsect2.para: Computes the intersection of dst with other and places the result in dst

refsect2.title: cairo_region_intersect_rectangle ()
refsect2.para: Computes the intersection of dst with rectangle and places the result in dst

refsect2.title: cairo_region_subtract ()
refsect2.para: Subtracts other from dst and places the result in dst

refsect2.title: cairo_region_subtract_rectangle ()
refsect2.para: Subtracts rectangle from dst and places the result in dst

refsect2.title: cairo_region_union ()
refsect2.para: Computes the union of dst with other and places the result in dst

refsect2.title: cairo_region_union_rectangle ()
refsect2.para: Computes the union of dst with rectangle and places the result in dst .

refsect2.title: cairo_region_xor ()
refsect2.para: Computes the exclusive difference of dst with other and places the result in dst . That is, dst will be set to contain all areas that are either in dst or in other , but not in both.

refsect2.title: cairo_region_xor_rectangle ()
refsect2.para: Computes the exclusive difference of dst with rectangle and places the result in dst . That is, dst will be set to contain all areas that are either in dst or in rectangle , but not in both.

refsect2.title: cairo_region_t
refsect2.para: A cairo_region_t represents a set of integer-aligned rectangles.
It allows set-theoretical operations like cairo_region_union() and cairo_region_intersect() to be performed on them.
Memory management of cairo_region_t is done with cairo_region_reference() and cairo_region_destroy().

refsect2.title: enum cairo_region_overlap_t
refsect2.para: Used as the return value for cairo_region_contains_rectangle().

entry.para: The contents are entirely inside the region. (Since 1.10)
The contents are entirely outside the region. (Since 1.10)
The contents are partially inside and partially outside the region. (Since 1.10)
